org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.system

Class ThreadBorrowingExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.system.ThreadBorrowingExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ThreadPool.ThreadBorrowable, java.util.concurrent.Executor

    public class ThreadBorrowingExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Executor, ThreadPool.ThreadBorrowable
    ThreadBorrowingExecutor is an Executor who is willing to have commands run on guest worker threads if caller prefers rather than run on one of the threads that the ThreadBorrowingExecutor itself owns.

      boolean canBorrowThread(java.lang.Thread thread)
      Caller guarantees that thread is a typical utility 'worker' thread (in contrast to, for example, the dedicated UI thread, or other threads on which work is dispatched through a Handler).

      • canBorrowThread

        public boolean canBorrowThread(java.lang.Thread thread)
        Description copied from interface: ThreadPool.ThreadBorrowable
        Caller guarantees that thread is a typical utility 'worker' thread (in contrast to, for example, the dedicated UI thread, or other threads on which work is dispatched through a Handler). Answer whether we are ok to dispatch here instead of one of our own worker threads. Caller must additionally assure themselves from their contextual knowledge that taking advantage of this function will not lead to deadlocks that otherwise would not occur.
        Specified by:
        canBorrowThread in interface ThreadPool.ThreadBorrowable
